result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Caleb W Odegard in court with attorney Peter M Wolff.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Nikole Kane appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court to address active warrant and bail. 

Court quashes warrant.

Atty Wolff presented arguments and states he has been retained by the Defendant for this case. 

Court will reinstate signature bond previously set. 

Atty Wolff requests a hearing in 30 days.  Hearing scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Bail/bond hearing on July 14, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Signed by Judge Brad D. Schimel on 07/11/2022

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Jack Rieder, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Caleb W Odegard not in court.   
Case scheduled for 8:30 am. and Matter called @ 9:37 am.

State motions the Court to issue a warrant for the defendant and to revoke and forfeit any bail.
Court orders a warrant be issued.
Bail is revoked and forfeited.
Body ONLY

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.   Defendant is not to enter any premises, other than a grocery store, that sells/serves alcohol beverages by the drink or into any liquor store. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant to have no contact with residence located at 1027 White Rock Ave. in the City of Wuakesha/The Destination bar/Daquese A. Wynn-Smith listed in the Criminal Complaint.

08:52 AM Defendant Caleb W Odegard in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.
Court advises of right to an attorney.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Hearing scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
